title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: America's Chip War with China Will Spread
items.description: Low-end legacy chips not subject to restrictions but vital to industry have given strength to Chinese manufacturers.

items.title: ‘I worked hard for my savings’: I’m 71 and a retired teacher. I want to give my kids money — but my daughter spends lavishly and my son is wealthy.
items.description: “I have been reading about the idea of giving your children money when they need it the most, rather than waiting until you die.”

items.title: I was laid off. I’m 43 and my husband is 35. I have $8,000 in credit-card debt and our mortgage is $1,600 a month. What do we do?
items.description: “We have been bringing in $60,000 a year for the last couple years, until this October, when I was laid off.”

items.title: Here's What Retirement on a Pension Looks Like in America
items.description: Retirees open up about their finances and how they spend their time.

items.title: ‘I’m betting on another 22 spins around the sun’: I’m 65 and have $3.9 million. How much should I realistically spend on a house?
items.description: “I have zero debt, no upcoming tax liabilities and no inheritance on the horizon.”

items.title: CoinDesk Dismisses Top Editors After Story Draws Crypto Executive's Ire
items.description: The article, since removed, featured a key CoinDesk sponsor and a $6 million banana.

items.title: Stocks Rally on Hopes for More Rate Cuts
items.description: Friday’s gains help, but don’t reverse, weekly declines by major indexes; Nike says it expects lower sales and margins this fiscal quarter.

items.title: Euro Likely to Weaken to Parity Against Dollar in 2025
items.description: The WSJ Dollar Index fell 0.5% to 102.08 — snapping a three-trading-day winning streak.

items.title: ‘She has two financially stable children’: Does it make sense for my wealthy mother, a recent widow, to take out a $100,000 life-insurance policy?
items.description: “It was generous of our mom to offer.”

items.title: ‘She is single and has a low-wage job’: I want to give my daughter, who is in her 30s, $50,000 for retirement. What could go wrong?
items.description: “She can invest aggressively, as she has over two decades to see her principal grow.”
